Once again the evil babelfish is hiding information that I really 
need. I've been trying to learn more about the town where Saito moved 
to and it seems to be located between two rivers. Unfortunately I'm 
not sure if I'm reading the names of these rivers correctly. It looks 
like one is called the Shingo river and the other says Izumisawa five 
Togawa. Would that be Izumisawa Goro Togawa? Or could they be named 
something else entirely? That sounds really odd for a river name. The 
site is www.gonohe.net/ 

Incidently, Gonohe is located near the city of Hachinohe, way below 
the area actually known as the Shimokita peninsula. This region is 
still fairly barren though. In fact, even today it seems farmers and 
others who live in the area move to Tokyo during the winter season.


-MissBehavin
